DataElement.preferredName: Refractory Disease Patient First-Line Therapy Cycle Four Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes no indicator if patient with disease that resists treatment has received 4 cycles of front line therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Refractory Disease Patient First-Line Therapy Cycle Four Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: First-Line Therapy Cycle Four Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has primary resist
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has primary resistant/refractory disease, has patient received at least 4 cycles of frontline chemotherapy?
